wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Jean Drummond Cooper (23 March 1922 – 15 September 2013) was an English nurse and nurse-tutor. She developed a view that theoretical knowledge should be applied to practical training, and wanted to improve the education of nurses and their competence. Cooper held tutoring positions at Northampton General Hospital and Addenbrooke's Hospital and later served as the Queen Elizabeth School of Nursing's principal.

response: * Margaret Cooper (nurse) (1922–2013), English nurse and nurse-tutor
* Margaret Cooper (WRNS officer) (1918–2016), worked at the signal interception and deciphering centre at Bletchley Park, England
